subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Bhagavad Gita: Duty on the Battlefield
description: A quick win: understand The Bhagavad Gita: Duty on the Battlefield.

hook.text: A warrior refuses to fight. A god drives his chariot and gives a lecture. The Gita is philosophy disguised as war story.

buildup.text: Prince Arjuna faces his relatives in battle and freezes. Krishna, his charioteer, reveals he is God and teaches.

discovery.text: Krishna says: act without attachment to results. Do your duty. Detachment, not inaction, is the path to freedom.

twist.text: The Gita offers three paths to God: knowledge, devotion, and selfless action. No single path is superior.

climax.text: Gandhi called the Gita his spiritual dictionary. Oppenheimer quoted it when he saw the atomic bomb. It speaks to all.

punchline.text: Act without clinging to results. The Gita's lesson: do your duty freely.

quiz.question: What does Krishna teach Arjuna in the Bhagavad Gita?
